main event: A round, silver colored object, the size of a silver dollar, was observed hovering at an angle for five seconds in Orville, California on May 20, 1955, before fading from sight.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for only 5 seconds, providing limited observation time.
The object was described as round, silver, and the size of a silver dollar, suggesting a small and metallic appearance.
It was initially concluded that the sighted object might have been a balloon due to the brevity of the sighting and the possibility of it being a balloon.
There were no follow-up investigations due to insufficient data for proper evaluation.
The object was seen moving up and down erratically before disappearing from view in a northward direction on May 6, 1955.
